place.name: CYFFIC
place.gazetteerText: CYFFIC, Kyffig, or Kiffick, a parish in the district of Narberth and county of Carmarthen; adjacent to the boundary with Pembroke, 4 miles S of Whitland r. station, and 5 SW by W of St. Clears. Post town, Whitland, under Narberth. Acres, 4, 556. Real property, £1, 950. Pop., 468. Houses, 93. The property is divided among a few. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of St. Davids. Value, £86.* Patron, the Vicar of Laugharne. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
